00053 }

00055 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00056  * @brief   This function handles Hard Fault exception.
00057  * @retval  None
00058  ************************************************************************************************************/
00059 void HardFault_Handler(void)
00060 {
00061   #if 1
00062 
00063   static vu32 gIsContinue = 0;
00064   /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00065   /* For development FW, MCU run into the while loop when the hardfault occurred.                           */
00066   /* 1. Stack Checking                                                                                      */
00067   /*    When a hard fault exception occurs, MCU push following register into the stack (main or process     */
00068   /*    stack). Confirm R13(SP) value in the Register Window and typing it to the Memory Windows, you can   */
00069   /*    check following register, especially the PC value (indicate the last instruction before hard fault).*/
00070   /*    SP + 0x00    0x04    0x08    0x0C    0x10    0x14    0x18    0x1C                                   */
00071   /*           R0      R1      R2      R3     R12      LR      PC    xPSR                                   */
00072   while (gIsContinue == 0)
00073   {
00074   }
00075   /* 2. Step Out to Find the Clue                                                                           */
00076   /*    Change the variable "gIsContinue" to any other value than zero in a Local or Watch Window, then     */
00077   /*    step out the HardFault_Handler to reach the first instruction after the instruction which caused    */
00078   /*    the hard fault.                                                                                     */
00079   /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00080 
00081   #else
00082 
00083   /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00084   /* For production FW, you shall consider to reboot the system when hardfault occurred.                    */
00085   /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00086   NVIC_SystemReset();
00087 
00088   #endif
00089 }

00115 extern vu32 guKeyState[2];
00116 
00117 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00118  * @brief   This function handles WAKEUP button interrupt.
00119  * @retval  None
00120  ************************************************************************************************************/
00121 __STATIC_INLINE void WAKEUP_Button_Process(void)
00122 {
00123   #if 1
00124   if (EXTI_GetEdgeFlag(GPIO2EXTI(HTCFG_WAKE_GPION)))
00125   {
00126     EXTI_ClearEdgeFlag(GPIO2EXTI(HTCFG_WAKE_GPION));
00127     guKeyState[0] = TRUE;
00128   }
00129   #else
00130   if (EXTI_GetEdgeStatus(GPIO2EXTI(HTCFG_WAKE_GPION), EXTI_EDGE_NEGATIVE))
00131   {
00132     EXTI_ClearEdgeFlag(GPIO2EXTI(HTCFG_WAKE_GPION));
00133   }
00134   else if (EXTI_GetEdgeStatus(GPIO2EXTI(HTCFG_WAKE_GPION), EXTI_EDGE_POSITIVE))
00135   {
00136     EXTI_ClearEdgeFlag(GPIO2EXTI(HTCFG_WAKE_GPION));
00137     guKeyState[0] = TRUE;
00138   }
00139   #endif
00140 }
00141 
00142 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00143  * @brief   This function handles KEY1 button interrupt.
00144  * @retval  None
00145  ************************************************************************************************************/
00146 __STATIC_INLINE void KEY1_Button_Process(void)
00147 {
00148   #if 1
00149   if (EXTI_GetEdgeFlag(GPIO2EXTI(HTCFG_KEY1_GPION)))
00150   {
00151     EXTI_ClearEdgeFlag(GPIO2EXTI(HTCFG_KEY1_GPION));
00152     guKeyState[1] = TRUE;
00153   }
00154   #else
00155   if (EXTI_GetEdgeStatus(GPIO2EXTI(HTCFG_KEY1_GPION), EXTI_EDGE_NEGATIVE))
00156   {
00157     EXTI_ClearEdgeFlag(GPIO2EXTI(HTCFG_KEY1_GPION));
00158     guKeyState[1] = TRUE;
00159   }
00160   else if (EXTI_GetEdgeStatus(GPIO2EXTI(HTCFG_KEY1_GPION), EXTI_EDGE_POSITIVE))
00161   {
00162     EXTI_ClearEdgeFlag(GPIO2EXTI(HTCFG_KEY1_GPION));
00163   }
00164   #endif
00165 }
00166 
00167 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00168  * @brief   This function handles EXTI interrupt.
00169  * @retval  None
00170  ************************************************************************************************************/
00171 void EXTI0_1_IRQHandler(void)
00172 {
00173   #if defined(USE_HT32F52253_SK)
00174   KEY1_Button_Process();
00175   #endif
00176 
00177   #if defined(USE_HT32F52341_SK)
00178   KEY1_Button_Process();
00179   #endif
00180 
00181   #if defined(USE_HT32F52352_SK)
00182   KEY1_Button_Process();
00183   #endif
00184 
00185   #if defined(USE_HT32F50030_SK)
00186   WAKEUP_Button_Process();
00187   #endif
00188 
00189   #if defined(USE_HT32F0006_DVB)
00190   KEY1_Button_Process();
00191   #endif
00192 
00193   #if defined(USE_HT32F61141_SK)
00194   KEY1_Button_Process();
00195   #endif
00196 
00197   #if defined(USE_HT32F65240_SK)
00198   KEY1_Button_Process();
00199   #endif
00200 
00201   #if defined(USE_HT32F65232_SK)
00202   KEY1_Button_Process();
00203   #endif
00204 
00205   #if defined(USE_BM53A367A_DVB)
00206   KEY1_Button_Process();
00207   #endif
00208 
00209   #if defined(USE_HT32F50452_SK)
00210   KEY1_Button_Process();
00211   #endif
00212 
00213   #if defined(USE_HT32F53252_SK)
00214   KEY1_Button_Process();
00215   #endif
00216 }
